newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway gives green light to gas power stations.
newsitem.headline: Norway gives green light to gas power stations.

text.p: The Norwegian Oil and Energy Ministry said on Thursday it had given the go-ahead to Naturkraft to build two natural gas-fired power stations on the west coast of Norway.

The two 350 megawatt plants, the first to be built in the oil-rich country which relies entirely on hydropower for electricity production, will be based at Kaarstoe and Kollsnes and will be supplied from the North Sea Troll gas field.
Construction on the first plant will likely begin in the summer, with work on the second starting next year.
Environmental groups had tried to block the building of the plants because of increasing emissions of carbon dioxide.

Naturkraft was set up specifically for the gas plant project and is a joint venture between Norsk Hydro ASA, Norway's largest electricity producer Statkraft A/S and state-owned oil company Den norske stats oljeselskap AS .
